comment: For a semester, it required an exorbitant amount of time. He assigns multiple Excel projects each week which require an advanced understanding of Excel. However, the professor is understanding, and his grading is generally fair. But the workload felt excessive and difficult.

Thank God I took finance courses that dealt with excel because that is basically all you are doing in this course. It really is not that complicated, if you know how to work excel. Professor is not very clear on what he exactly wants for the projects, he gives you videos from another professor so, class could use some improvements.

It is a lot of work but he will work with you if you put in the effort. Very understanding, and actually cares that you learn the material. He could be a bit more detailed in his video walkthroughs but overall, great professor.

I took this class and it was a huge mistake, this tells you nothing about how to manage a company, it is a advanced excel class, with very little instruction given on the homework, the data used is way out of control in the amount, you ask questions and its refer to the video which is useless, he does not offer help along the way.

DO NOT TAKE IF YOU ARE NOT COMFORTABLE/FAMILIAR WITH EXCEL. I was fortunate enough to have experience with excel so it was fine for me, but some of my classmates were STRUGGLING. 4 discussions and about 15 excel assignment. Some of the assignments have videos and gives you a good idea on what to do, but some do not. so, I would proceed with caution
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: His Assignments are not explained well. I ask for help and he acted like he couldn't help for the assignment and he told me to look at videos which I did and they did not help whatsoever. I don't recommend him, He also told me how other students completed the assignment with no problem and I didn't care because I need you help.

This class is not laid out well, and it's very confusing. Assignments are not explained well. Even if you try your hardest to give him what you THINK he wants, he grades you poorly and nitpicks every detail of your work. Unfortunately, as of right now, there are only 2 professors who teach this class at KSU. All I have to say is good luck...

I am taking online and honestly I am just so unbelievably confused. He might be a good professor in person but do not take his online class I have no idea what's going on and I'm usually an A student.

Professor Swaim created such a welcoming and engaging learning environment! His friendly demeanor made the class feel approachable and enjoyable, and the lectures were always interesting and thought-provoking. I especially appreciated the in-class problems. This course is very easy, just come to class. One final exam. One presentation, super easy

This class was not hard. He graded easily; the tests were a breeze if you did the homework. He forgot to put the group project on D2L until a week before it was due, so I did it all by myself because Projects is not software that can be shared over Teams. He did talk to us like we were idiots when speaking about technology.

Took online.  Uses Connect, so a lot of reading.  I also purchased the textbook, which I personally recommend for notetaking.  Study guide for each exam.  Exams are open notes, open book.  DO NOT MISS the video lectures for using the PM Software. They're VERY HELPFUL. Google is helpful. This is a SENIOR level class, he expects Senior Level work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment:
I don't remember If attendance was mandatory or not. I put no? This class was pretty difficult, and we did use the book for connect quizzes and smartbook that was only a small part of our grade though. The smartbook and quizzes do take up time to complete.

Test were open note, but the test were pencil and paper in class. Good luck.

Great and wonderful professor. But when it came to teaching, I struggled. His lecture comes from someone else's lecture powerpoint, and I have no idea where he gets the material for the exams. He is not tech savvy, so the D2L grading system was a mess, and he will make you come in person to take exams, which is silly if you drive far

uses connect so smart books and quizzes every week. lectures are longg and boring, but attendance is 10% of ur grade. 1 group project that was pretty easy. the information is boring and hard to grasp. tests are open note but i still did poorly on them, powerpoints didnt correlate to the study guide, had to look up a lot

He uses connect, so expect smartbooks and quizzes every week. they arent hard just really time consuming. his lectures are informative but very very boring. attendance is 10% of your grade. 3 tests but open note and study guide provided. a group project that wasnt too hard, 3 ms project assignments that are hard, meet with ur classmates for those!!

I took this course online and although the textbook is required, most of his quizzes focused around the video lectures he posts each week. There is one group project, three quizzes (not cumulative), no lockdown browser, and he encourages you to use all notes you have. His grading is very fair and he is generally a nice guy and would take again.

Take him if you want a super easy class. I am not saying you don't have to work for an A but it is mostly Connect assignments, exams (no lockdown or camera), and a group project on interesting stuff!! Impacts of Covid on certain companies etc...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this class online during a summer semester and it was really easy! The homework assignments are helpful and the professor provides supplemental info for each chapter that explains much better than the book. Watch the lecture videos/do the homework each week & you'll do great!

Took this class online over the Summer and it was not bad at all. Class was out of 610 points with Quizzes and Learnsmarts worth 90 points each. Easy 175-180 points... Two tests worth 75 points a piece. Easy 140-15 points... A Service encounter project due by the end of the semester thats worth 100 points and a final worth 180. Follow direction!!!

I usually dislike Rate My Professor as it normally is a venting place for people (like me). But here I go. I don't hate teachers like I hate this one. Had the disprivilege of emailing with this man, he comes off rude. His grading is almost exclusively group work which he grades with a chainsaw. I have had to take him twice as I had no choice..

Easy class. All Learnsmarts/quizzes/test are found online. You also have a group project (graded kinda hard but got a B with minimal effort) and the final exam which everyone complains about but if you have chegg all the answers are there. Pulled a 92 with not one minute of studying this semester. Never opened the book or notes.

Overall, this professor isn't terrible but throughout the whole semester we were learning the material in one way, but when it came to the final exam, there were questions in a mathematical format that he never tested before. They were more like statistics or app stat class material. Don't take him unless you want to learn information on your own.

Do not take!!! Professor Swaim gives all his assignments through learnsmart and connect plus a group project which he grades hard on and a final which is impossible and nothing like what we learn through the online activities.. I had an A until the final and that dropped my grade down to a C.

He seemed pretty nit picky on the project . No one in the class got an A. Homework and quizzes are easy, but the final is 5 math questions that weren't taught in the class. They were relevant to what I learned in Short term financing, and Appstats, but I still had not learned quite as far as this prof was asking. I wouldn't take him online again.

Quick to reply to e-mail/questions. Sometimes follow up is necessary. Learnsmart activities were tedious. Easy quizzes + exams. Final was difficult, only 5 questions w/ lot of math. Don't wait last minute for group project and you will be fine! Definitely not a class you should do poorly in, just put in some effort and don't create subpar work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Why are people rating Swaim low? Easy class, Learnsmart activities + open note quizzes + exams. Final is difficult, though. Easy semester-long group project w/ clear + fair grading. Timing of exams are weird, but he's always been flexible and very kind throughout the semester. Good class to take ONL if you want guaranteed A!

The class I took was not, by any means, a learning experience. It was mainly Connect and Learnsmart activities. It's rather upsetting to have to pay college tuition, to simply learn from a book. The professor did not add any material to this course, besides a group project. I would stay away from Swaim and other online mgt courses at KSU.

Dr. Swaim is a businessman. If you respect him and listen, you will learn a lot! He cares about teaching things that you need to know in the business world and some life advice, too! This is largely a discussion class, so attendance, while not required, is important. Is it the easiest class? Nope, but it's a 4000 level class. Suck it up buttercup!

He is a great teacher that makes your learning experience as fulfilled as he can. He is not one to waste your time. However, he expects that in return you respect his time too. He is religiously available during his office hours and makes it easy to get an A if you are willing to earn it! Come to class, listen, and do the homework! You'll get a B/A

The worst i've ever done in any online class in my entire life! I think everyone dropped during add/drop  and my group partners vanished! do no take  his class online because this professor is of no help. The group project was not organized well and overall the content is better learned in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The midterm & final were hard and the study guides were not helpful. They are made up of math problems and formulas, so practice out of the textbook. The quizzes are questions from a quiz bank (they are on google). There is 2 case studies (medium difficulty) and 3 sets of group problems (usually 3 in each set), and group paper. Pick a good group!!!

There is a quiz for each chapter, a midterm and final (timed short answer and math questions), 3 sets of team problems, and a group project for the semester. Pick a good group, because it requires a lot of time in the semester and need people to do their work. The midterm and final are at a specific 2 hour period he picks and kinda difficult.
Puts WAY too much emphasis on the group paper for an online class. I put in countless hours into this class only to end up with a high C. AVOID THIS CLASS LIKE THE PLAGUE THAT IT IS. TRUST ME.
Make sure that you pick a good team!  Several projectspapers rely on team work - bad team mates and you are sunk!  Prof. is a stickler for word count and concise papers.

I emailed him several times over the semester according to the contact method in the syllabus and I never received a response. He provides little to no guidance on any of the course work. This is pretty much an independent study type of situation. He provides a confusing amount of instructions at the beginning of class. Group work is ridiculous.

I took this class online and was expecting it to be very challenging. Surprisingly, the class was very reasonable. The workload is much lighter than other mgmt classes that I took. Capsim work was simple. We did Foundaitons and Gazillionaire instead of Compxm this semester. Very easy stuff. I would highly recommend this professor.

Took online. IMO he's the best option for the class. Fair grader, fair coursework. There's nothing in this class that will upset you, which is not the case for a lot of MGT courses. As always make sure you get in a good group. Can't comment on his helpfulness or lack thereof, never emailed him. It's a very easy B, moderately difficult A.

Super unclear and sarcastic all semester. Avoid like the plague. Final Presentation was a video with absolutely no guidelines or input from professor until after "graded chat" where all he does is tell you what you did wrong in the video.

Don't understand all of the negative comments, this class is incredibly easy. Online class consists of 10 online quizzes with no due dates. Group assignments will take all semester, don't procrastinate because he does grade fairly. He only requires 60% grade on comp xm and foundation for full credit. Easiest professor for this class probably.
Took online class. Very good material. Enjoyed his class and learned alot. Work was minimal. Just do the work and you will be fine!

One of the worst professors I have had at KSU. He is very rude and doesn't explain things well. When I asked him questions about stuff relating to the course, he would refer me to a hotline number instead of helping me himself. I would avoid this professor at all costs. Take someone else! It'll be the best decision you ever made.

I would not recommend this guy to any person in need of accomplishing MGT 3200. He is absolutely no help and ruins a class that is actually applicable to the real world. I am walking out of there with a B, but literally have no idea what happened in that class. Worst professor i have ever had. Take quizzes and go to class and you should get a b.

The class itself sucks, so be prepared. He's not the best, not the worst. He wouldn't be my first option for another class, but I wouldn't avoid him like the plague. High use of the book. Tests are difficult and study guide provided was not very useful. Attendance taken. Quizzes graded on completion. Group project.
comprehension is critical in this class.

Took his online Strategic Management course Summer 2011. Had taken him for 3200 and so I kind of knew what to expect from him. He's very structured in his delivery, makes sure to explain things if it's needed and the class is fairly easy as long as you make sure to read and comprehend the material. Overall a great class, and CapSim was very useful.
Very knowledgeable, makes the toughest material easy to understand.

This class was relatively simple if (1) you came to class and (2) you used your textbook.  His lectures are based on the Power Points provided by the book publisher.  HOWEVER, the tests are based on the problems in the book!  He's funny if you enjoy Seinfeld and Curb Your Enthusiasm...?

1 word to describe him, LAZY. is is not helpful. I had him for an online class and he left out so many key points that we needed to know when completing our project. For our capsim assignment, his response to any question about it was to contact them. Why couldn't he answer it???? Once again, LAZY teacher. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

Took this class online. He grades pretty hard. You have a 35 page business plan due at the end of the semester which is a group project and 40% of your grade. Didnt really enjoy the class and I didn't learn anything.
Boring!Does not explain things well and tests are not really based on class lectures.

Worst professor I have ever had. He is rude to students, unwilling to help and when he does its with an attitude that you're annoying him. He gave us a mid-term on half the book with 5 discussion questions and no study guide at all. He just sat there and read the book headings in class. This guy had me scared whether or not I was going to graduate.

He knows his stuff and his tests are difficult, but its not impossible to make an A. He gives you a study guide and he is a great professor. He can get a bit agitated at times with students, but I would take him over again. I plan to anyway. He makes the material easy to relate to.
Lectures are extremely boring, attendance counts towards your grade and there's a group project. Read the slides and you'll be fine for the exams.

PAINFULLY boring. His lectures are so dull it's really hard to focus on them. He is SO excited about management it's actually crazy. And he has an attendance policy so you have to sit through it. Test's are pretty easy though if you can make it through the lectures.

took class online. it was really hard. too much work. weekly discussion, weekly quiz and finals in campus, open book but too hard. lots of calculation. harsh in grading. not very nice when replying to discussions.
he keeps the class pretty interesting. He tells you exactly what's on the test. I made sure to go over everything he mentioned for the exam review and got A's on the exam and in the class.
Very likable professor who is always willing to help.  uses his own experiences to relate to the material. need to come to class as he does take and give attendance points.
